description: From Middle English brended (“burnt, branded”), from bren (“burned, branded”), from the past participle of brennen (“to burn”), from Old English bærnan (“to burn”).  Also compare Old Norse brǫndóttr, Icelandic bröndóttr (“brindled”).

adjectives.description: brinded (comparative more brinded, superlative most brinded)

entries.meaning: (archaic, dialect) Especially of the fur or skin of animals: having a patchy or streaky pattern, usually brown or grey in colour; brindled.
